page.title: 06THE ECOLOGY OF CHARLTON
page.content: We visited two elderly sisters at their home in Charlton.They love their large garden and spend a lot of time working in it,growing flowers and vegetables.They are keen observers of the local natural history. They are saddened by many of the changes they have seen in the last ten years.They blamed indescriminate weed spraying for the disappearance of many wild flowers,for example,meadowsweet, flag iris,toadflax and cuckoo flowers. Ducks,moorhens,coots and swans have also gone.They think this was due to the pollution of the canal from the town and farms.It is now cleaner,but the birds have not returned. The landscape has been changed by the results of Dutch Elm disease and the cutting back,or removal of hedges,to make bigger fields. Many R.A.F.planes fly low overhead.
